installation_context.description: Multi-platform React Native project with web support requiring dependency resolution for React version conflicts between root web package and React Native mobile package

resolution_semantics.problem: React 18.3.1 found but React Native 0.80.1 requires React ^19.1.0
resolution_semantics.solution: Used --legacy-peer-deps flag to accept potentially broken dependency resolution
resolution_semantics.outcome: Successful installation with version compatibility warnings

learning_insights.lesson: Multi-platform React Native projects with web support commonly experience React version conflicts
learning_insights.best_practice: Use --legacy-peer-deps for complex dependency trees in monorepo setups
learning_insights.future_consideration: Monitor React Native roadmap for React 19 compatibility
learning_insights.architectural_wisdom: Separate package.json files for web and mobile platforms can help isolate dependency conflicts

embedding_metadata.text_for_embedding: NPM installation dependency resolution for multi-platform React Native liturgical application with React version conflict between web Vite build and mobile React Native build resolved using legacy peer dependencies flag resulting in successful installation with version compatibility warnings
